result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 5 days. Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for school

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees from bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling

Correction to 01-28-16 sentencing entry:
Court granted States request for no firearms or weapons during the probationary period of this case.

-No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding;
-No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses or drug dealings.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

-Cooperate with agent;
-Defendant required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

-AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment;
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for school.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Lamar Jefferson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Bond Refund Packet
Reflects 02-08-16 NOTES entry correcting Firearms restriction language
Correction made to the sentencing previously made on 01-28-2016: Court granted State's request for no firearms or weapons during the probationary period of this case.
2/5/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.  Additional statements made by Defendant's mother.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant sentenced to serve  6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for school.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees from bail on deposit, if any, with the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealings.
*  Community service of 50 hours.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 30 DAYS Condition Time at the House of Correction FORTHWITH with Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for school.

Court WILL consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED AND READ-IN.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea. Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel is ill and requests an adjourned plea and sentencing date.  Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Statements by atty Toran that he has not been formally retained.  Case adjourned for another status of conference in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by atty Valdez that defendant has retained atty Toran who is unable to appear today.  Court vacates jury trial date of 10-21-2015 and orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests Final pretrial and Jury trial dates.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that there are issues with discovery and requests additional time to review discovery.  Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court with attorney Ramon Arellano Valdez.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel needs additional time to review offer and requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  Defendant now qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states that his mother hired an attorney named Jonathan Morola who was unable to appear on this date.    Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46.  Attorney is to be with defendant on next court date. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 04-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is not eligible for representation by the public defender's office.  Defendant requests time to retain counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 46. jks
  Status conference scheduled for 03-24-2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court is DOWN on 2-13-2015.  This case was scheduled for that date in Out of Custody Intake Court.  Case rescheduled for 2-24-2015 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 46. jks

Court ordered ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession of any illegal drugs without a valid prescription, and no possession of any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this case.
Court ordered the remaining bail of ($250.00) to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Alex Lamar Jefferson in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Reserve, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant states he doesn't want public defender representation. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
